availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leander Martin Cox (Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married to Emily Thompson Cox on September 18, 1838. Married to Margaret P. Cox. Father to Nannie B. Cox, Andrew T. Cox, and Thomas H. Cox. Served as a Captain in the 3rd Kentucky Infantry in the Mexican-American War, Company B in 1847. Served as an Elector for the Ninth District of Kentucky for the Whig Party in 1852. Attorney in Fleming County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Fleming Count in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Fleming County in 1860.
